macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Rise on January 23, 2026
items.summary: Dow Jones Industrials gained 0.63% to 49,384, S&P 500 added roughly 0.6%, Nasdaq Composite up 0.6%, and Russell 2000 hit a record close amid mixed trading with dips but higher finish. US500 fell slightly 0.09% to 6907 points in latest session after 0.97% gain prior day.
items.source: SP Angel; Axon Markets; Trading Economics; Fully Informed

items.title: Gold Surges Over 7% Weekly to $4,930/oz; Silver Hits $101.8/oz
items.summary: Gold prices rose to $4,970/oz overnight before consolidating at $4,930/oz, marking over 7% weekly gain; silver reached $101.8/oz. Tin climbed to $53,400/t while oil dipped slightly to $64.6/bbl.

items.title: Eurozone Flash PMIs Show Continued Output Growth in January
items.summary: Eurozone flash PMIs indicated output continued to grow in January with strengthened business confidence.

items.title: Asian Markets Mixed; Jakarta Composite Declines 0.46%
items.summary: Nikkei 225 up 0.29% to 53,847, Hang Seng +0.45% to 26,750, Shanghai Composite +0.33% to 4,136; Indonesia's JCI fell 0.46% to 8,951 with 9 sectors declining, transportation most sluggish.

items.title: Mining Stocks Mixed; Freeport-McMoRan Reiterates Grasberg Restart
items.summary: Freeport-McMoRan quarterly report confirms Grasberg restart plan amid -2.9% daily drop; other miners like BHP +0.7%, Rio Tinto -1.5%, Glencore +0.5%, Newmont +2.3%. Dollar Index eased to 98.42.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Rises 0.94% to $3.04T Amid Mixed Trading
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market cap reached $3.04T, up 0.94% in the last 24 hours, with Bitcoin trading between $88,515 and $90,340, currently at $89,181 down 0.90%. Major coins like ETH (-2.56%), XRP (-2.66%), and SOL (-2.06%) declined, while outperformers included SENT (+137%), ENSO (+53%), and TRX (+2.80%).

items.title: U.S. Spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs See Largest Withdrawals in Two Months
items.summary: U.S. spot Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs recorded their largest outflows in two months, amid broader market pressures and Bitcoin's recent price consolidation.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis Shows Potential Decline to $88,000 or Lower
items.summary: Bitcoin rose 0.29% over the past day to $89,139 but faces seller dominance, with a false breakout below $88,548 support; further drop to $88,000 possible, midterm bearish outlook toward $85,225.

items.title: Ark Invest Forecasts Massive Digital Asset Growth by 2030
items.summary: Ark Invest projects significant expansion in digital assets by 2030, highlighted as a top story alongside tokenized precious metals gaining traction amid price surges.

items.title: Innovative Crypto ETFs Positioned for 2026 Surprises
items.summary: New ETFs like NEOS Bitcoin High Income ETF, Grayscale Ethereum Staking ETF, and others offer income generation and staking amid Bitcoin's post-rally consolidation and improving regulations.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: UCSB Hosts Inaugural Agentic AI Summit Today
items.summary: UC Santa Barbara's Center for Responsible Machine Learning is hosting the first CRML Agentic AI Summit on January 23, 2026, convening researchers, innovators, and students to discuss agentic AI systems that autonomously plan, reason, and act on complex goals, marking a shift beyond generative models.

items.title: AI Magazine Highlights Top Five AI Stories Including Intel, Apple, NVIDIA
items.summary: AI Magazine summarizes the week's top AI developments as of January 23, featuring major players like Intel, Apple, NVIDIA, and BlackRock, covering recent industry news.

items.title: CACM: Synthetic Data Enables Training LLMs on Non-Existent Real-World Data
items.summary: A January 23, 2026 article discusses how synthetic data substitutes for unavailable physical world data to train large language models effectively.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Highguard Hero Shooter On Track for January 26 Release
items.summary: Wildlight Entertainment's Highguard shows recent Steam activity confirming its January 26 launch on PS5, PC, and Xbox despite weeks of silence and community skepticism over the oversaturated hero shooter market.[1]

items.title: Ubisoft Cancels Six Games Including Prince of Persia Remake
items.summary: Ubisoft announced the cancellation of six titles, including the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time remake, while closing two studios and restructuring into five 'Creative Houses' focused on key IPs like Assassin's Creed.[2][4][6]

items.title: Xbox Developer Direct Showcases Fable Reboot
items.summary: The Xbox Developer Direct highlighted the anticipated Fable reboot, the first major entry since 2008, alongside other upcoming titles amid 2026 Xbox lineup discussions.[2][3]

items.title: Epic and Google Reach Secret $800 Million Deal
items.summary: Epic Games and Google have formed an unexpected partnership involving an $800 million deal, highlighted in court as Fortnite returns to the Google Play Store.[2]

items.title: Global Games Show Abu Dhabi 2025 Concludes Successfully
items.summary: The event gathered over 5,000 attendees, 100+ speakers, and companies to discuss gaming's future with Web3, AI, esports, and blockchain, fostering cross-industry partnerships.[5]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Capital One to acquire Brex in landmark $5.15bn deal
items.summary: Capital One announced a major acquisition of fintech company Brex for $5.15 billion, marking a significant consolidation in the financial technology sector.

items.title: JP Morgan acquires WealthOS to boost pensions offering
items.summary: JP Morgan expanded its financial services capabilities by acquiring WealthOS to strengthen its pensions and wealth management offerings.

items.title: Airwallex enters South Korean market with Paynuri acquisition
items.summary: Fintech company Airwallex expanded into South Korea through the acquisition of Paynuri, strengthening its presence in the Asian market.

items.title: ThetaRay names Brad Levy as CEO, succeeding Peter Reynolds
items.summary: Fintech company ThetaRay announced a leadership change with Brad Levy taking over as CEO from Peter Reynolds.

items.title: Société Générale to cut 1,800 jobs in France
items.summary: Major European bank Société Générale announced significant workforce reductions with 1,800 job cuts planned in France.

items.title: TikTok launches PineDrama standalone microdrama app
items.summary: TikTok launched its own dedicated short-form scripted drama application called PineDrama, entering the growing microdrama market.

items.title: GammaTime raises $14 million for microdrama platform
items.summary: New microdrama app GammaTime from Hollywood veterans secured $14 million in funding from investors including Alexis Ohanian, Kris Jenner, and Kim Kardashian.
